oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pages from the Year-Book of the N. B. Forrest Chapter, No. 206, United Daughters of the Confederacy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Haywood County had a group of Woodland Stars, ladies who wrapped bandages and made uniforms during the Civil War. They later joined the United Daughters of the Confederacy. Each month, the U.D.C. programs featured a Confederate hero.; Two pages included here show the programs for Sam Davis and Gen. Felix Zollicoffer.
